evidence.text: 17 | 2021-10-15 | MOTION Request for a three-judge panel pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 2284(a) by Taiwan Scott, South Carolina State Conference of the NAACP, The. Response to Motion due by 10/29/2021. Add an additional 3 days only if served by mail or otherwise allowed under Fed. R. Civ. P. 6 or Fed. R. Crim. P. 45.

extracted.value: Taiwan Scott, South Carolina State Conference of the NAACP, The filed a motion requesting a three-judge panel under 28 U.S.C. § 2284(a) on 10/15/2021, seeking expedited consideration of their constitutional challenge to South Carolina's legislative districts.

evidence.text: 59 | 2021-11-09 | MOTION for Preliminary Injunction by Taiwan Scott, South Carolina State Conference of the NAACP, The. Response to Motion due by 11/23/2021. Add an additional 3 days only if served by mail or otherwise allowed under Fed. R. Civ. P. 6 or Fed. R. Crim. P. 45.

extracted.value: Taiwan Scott, South Carolina State Conference of the NAACP, The filed a motion for preliminary injunction on 11/09/2021, requesting immediate relief to prevent enforcement of South Carolina's legislative districts pending judicial review.

evidence.text: 57 | 2021-11-09 | MOTION to Dismiss or in the Alternative, MOTION to Stay the Case by Harvey Peeler, Luke A Rankin. Response to Motion due by 11/23/2021. Add an additional 3 days only if served by mail or otherwise allowed under Fed. R. Civ. P. 6 or Fed. R. Crim. P. 45.

extracted.value: Harvey Peeler and Luke A Rankin filed a motion to dismiss or stay the case on 11/09/2021, arguing Plaintiffs' constitutional challenge is not yet ripe for judicial review due to pending state legislative actions.

evidence.text: 61 | 2021-11-09 | MOTION TO DISMISS FOR FAILURE TO STATE A CLAIM, MOTION to Dismiss for Lack of Jurisdiction ( Response to Motion due by 11/23/2021. Add an additional 3 days only if served by mail or otherwise allowed under Fed. R. Civ. P. 6 or Fed. R. Crim. P. 45. ) by Henry D McMaster.

extracted.value: Henry D McMaster filed a motion to dismiss for failure to state a claim on 11/09/2021, challenging the legal sufficiency of Plaintiffs' constitutional claims against state defendants.
